projects.spatial.nodes

Class PRQuadBlackNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • projects.spatial.nodes.PRQuadNode
      • projects.spatial.nodes.PRQuadBlackNode

  • public class PRQuadBlackNode
extends PRQuadNode

    A PRQuadBlackNode is a "black" PRQuadNode. It maintains the following invariants:

    • It does not have children.
    • Once created, it will contain at least one KDPoint.

    YOU ***** MUST ***** IMPLEMENT THIS CLASS!

        public static final int DEFAULT_BUCKETSIZE

    • Constructor Detail

      • PRQuadBlackNode

        public PRQuadBlackNode(KDPoint centroid,
                       int k,
                       int bucketingParam)
        Creates a PRQuadBlackNode with the provided parameters.
        Parameters:
        centroid - The KDPoint which will act as the centroid of the quadrant spanned by the current PRQuadBlackNode.
        k - An integer to which 2 is raised to define the side length of the quadrant spanned by the current PRQuadBlackNode. See PRQuadTree.PRQuadTree(int, int) for a full explanation of how k works.
        bucketingParam - The bucketing parameter provided to us PRQuadTree.
        See Also:
        PRQuadTree.PRQuadTree(int, int), PRQuadBlackNode(KDPoint, int, int, KDPoint)

      • PRQuadBlackNode

        public PRQuadBlackNode(KDPoint centroid,
                       int k,
                       int bucketingParam,
                       KDPoint p)
        Creates a PRQuadBlackNode with the provided parameters.
        Parameters:
        centroid - The centroid of the quadrant spanned by the current PRQuadBlackNode.
        k - The exponent to which 2 is raised in order to define the side of the current quadrant. Refer to PRQuadTree.PRQuadTree(int, int) for a thorough explanation of this parameter.
        bucketingParam - The bucketing parameter of the PRQuadBlackNode, passed to us by the PRQuadTree or PRQuadGrayNode during object construction.
        p - The KDPoint with which we want to initialize this.
        See Also:
        DEFAULT_BUCKETSIZE, PRQuadTree.PRQuadTree(int, int), PRQuadBlackNode(KDPoint, int, int)

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        public PRQuadNode insert(KDPoint p,
                         int k)

        Inserting a KDPoint into a PRQuadBlackNode can have one of two outcomes:

        1. If, after the insertion, the node's capacity is still SMALLER THAN OR EQUAL TO the bucketing parameter, we should simply store the KDPoint internally.
        2. If, after the insertion, the node's capacity SURPASSES the bucketing parameter, we will have to SPLIT the current PRQuadBlackNode into a PRQuadGrayNode which will recursively insert all the availableKDPoints. This pprocess will continue until we reach a PRQuadGrayNode which successfully separates all the KDPoints of the quadrant it represents. Programmatically speaking, this means that the method will polymorphically call itself, splitting black nodes into gray nodes as long as is required for there to be a set of 4 quadrants that separate the points between them. This is one of the major bottlenecks in PR-QuadTrees; the presence of a pair of KDPoints with a very small distance between them can negatively impact search in certain subplanes, because the subtrees through which those subplanes will be modeled will be "unnecessarily" tall.
        Specified by:
        insert in class PRQuadNode
        Parameters:
        p - A KDPoint to insert into the subtree rooted at the current node.
        k - The side length of the quadrant spanned by the current PRQuadGrayNode. It will need to be updated per recursive call to help guide the input KDPoint to the appropriate subtree.
        Returns:
        The subtree rooted at the current node, potentially adjusted after insertion.

      • delete

        public PRQuadNode delete(KDPoint p)

        Successfully deleting a KDPoint from a PRQuadBlackNode always decrements its capacity by 1. If, after deletion, the capacity is at least 1, then no further changes need to be made to the node. Otherwise, it can be scrapped and turned into a white node.

        If the provided KDPoint is not contained by this, no changes should be made to the internal structure of this, which should be returned as is.

        Specified by:
        delete in class PRQuadNode
        Parameters:
        p - The KDPoint to delete from this.
        Returns:
        Either this or null, depending on whether the node underflows.

      • search

        public boolean search(KDPoint p)
        Description copied from class: PRQuadNode
        Searches the subtree rooted at the current node for the provided KDPoint.
        Specified by:
        search in class PRQuadNode
        Parameters:
        p - The KDPoint to search for.
        Returns:
        true if p was found in the subtree rooted at the current nodes, false otherwise.

      • height

        public int height()
        Description copied from class: PRQuadNode
        Return the height of the subtree rooted at the current nodes. The height is defined similarly to AVL trees, as follows:
        1. The height of a null tree (no nodes) is -1 (minus 1).
        2. The height of a tree that consists of a single node (a "stub" tree) is 0 (zero).
        3. The height of a tree that consists of four children is the maximum height of its children plus one.

        Specified by:
        height in class PRQuadNode
        Returns:
        the height of the subtree rooted at the current node.

      • getPoints

        public java.util.Collection<KDPoint> getPoints()
        Returns all the KDPoints contained by the PRQuadBlackNode. INVARIANT: the returned Collection's size can only be between 1 and bucket-size inclusive.
        Returns:
        A Collection that contains all the KDPoints that are contained by the node. It is guaranteed, by the invariants, that the Collection will not be empty, and it will also not be a null reference.
